alert.note: Alert for Anoka; Hennepin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 8:39PM CDT until further notice by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Mississippi River AT Hwy 610 @ Brooklyn Pk affecting Hennepin and Anoka Counties. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt upstream snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River AT Hwy 610 @ Brooklyn Pk. * WHEN...From Friday evening until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 800 PM CDT Thursday, the stage was 10.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening and continue rising to a crest of 15.0 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.6 feet on 05/02/1975. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
